text: Ah, this day is coming. The day we Christians have been warning the world about for centuries. And when it comes it will be the Biggest event to ever take place in Human History. Millions of people will instantly vanish from right in front of your eyes. But this event will also bring about more hatred towards God, as people will blame him for doing this and taking their loved ones away from them. The heart's and minds of people will be blinded and deafened on an intense scale like never witnessed before in human history towards God. And yet even after witnessing such an event people will still deny Christ. text: I believe this is what's going to happen when Jesus comes. His second coming. In the Bible, when He comes, He will be like a thief in the night (no one will know when He's coming). And those who are saved will go to heaven first and escape the years and years of suffering. Plagues, countless murders, famines, natural disasters. Yes that's happening now but it will be 1000 times worse. During those years, we will still have an opportunity to be saved. But our faith in God will be tested beyond the limits. It will only be too late when Jesus comes back, not as a Lamb but as a King, along with His angels to give the final judgment to all the human race. Every knee will bow and every tongue will praise Him. Doesn't matter at that time if you have salvation or not. Every single living creature will bow. There will be those who will live in the light and those who will be thrown into the darkness forever. This movie may not be entirely based on the Bible but as far this trailer goes, where else can you get a story line like this from? No where else except the Bible.  God loves eveyone. And He doesn't want anyone to perish. He wants us to be ready so that we don't get left behind cause those who aren't ready, the things that are coming will be horrific.

text: The trailer was great.  The commenters, not so much.  If you're a non-Christian please be respectful of other people's beliefs.  We try to not offend you, but yet you offend us every day with your speech, your mannerisms, your belligerent attitude toward us, etc.  If you don't want to see a Christian movie, here's an idea, DON'T WATCH THE TRAILER!!!!  You know what it's about, so shut up, it's coming in the theaters, and you can't say or do anything about it. Every year there are countless Godless movies that depict total debauchery, murder, violence, sex, and war that slander our God to pieces.  We never say a word about it.  Most of us just stay quiet and not watch the movie.  Yet you get so upset over ONE movie that dares to go against the grain and against your way of thinking!  Hypocrites!  It's no wonder we think you're serving the Devil.  With the animosity and cruelty you display to us, you really are the Devil's children!

text: According the apparently infallible bible, Christ was supposed to return within the lifetime of his disciples.  Here we are 2000 years, later with 1000 years of dark ages, countless religious wars, Crusades, Inquistion, Huguenots, witch trials...and people are still dumb enough to believe in this literally?!!  This is all a perverted conceit of self-righteous and hypocritical religious wingnuts thinking they're called or special (when they already live on the richest nation on earth), and ignoring real problems and evil in this world...like child hunger, warcrimes, global warming.  Revelation was written by a historically anonymous zealot monk.  It was a highly controversial addition to the bible when this bible was first compiled 300 years after the death of Christ, and which Christ had no idea about and certainly made no reference to.  Yes, Jesus loved magic and dogma and doomsday prophecies, while ignoring his fellow man.  Total BS.  I suggest we learn by his example, than by some of his loony followers.

There are other gods yes but only one returned from where he came, he also left with us the gift of his spirit. The grace of Christ makes a mockery of religion that's why he was murdered, (and after the fall of grace by Adam is why he had to be sacrifice). The grace of the father allows us to choose, but my standard of choosing do not justify condemning you for the decisions you make. Mat. 10:16 So be wise as serpents and innocent as doves, ESV. Regardless of what anyone believes, the truth will be revealed, one way or another. Who wants to wait and find out? time is short, (at least in most cases 70 years) otherwise it won't matter one way or another. Rev. 11:12 And they overcame him because of the blood of the Lamb and because of the word of their testimony, and they did not love their life even when faced with death. text: Sad but non-believers are a slaves of darkness, b/c your mind is limited to your 5 senses. Every contact that human’s have ever had in this world comes to you through his five senses.  We have gained no knowledge outside of them.  So it comes through sense perception. This is why people who have only contacted the physical through the senses will deny the existence of God, because he cannot find Him in the material world. The carnal minded person interests are the things which are confined to the five senses which are unstable, vanishing and fleeting pleasures in this world. Sometimes we think we know, and then it’s nothing at all like what we thought. Most people want to deal with a God that they can control, we don’t want him to infringe upon certain things in our life that we don’t want to deal with.  So consequently, we take what should be spiritual and we make it religion. You are blinded by the power of Satan and he's successful at keeping you in the dark. You act as if you have the power to change things as you daily witness how dark this world is becoming, and you have no power to do a thing about it, none, but yet you believe you know more than the Lord. You've never created a World and you're not certain of anything including your own life.  So your wannabe belief is powerless. The devil is a deceiver. Folks that write this kind of mess are acting like the Lord is sitting in Heaven wringing his hands about this, how deceived are your ego's. You're a carnal minded person, basically dead because your mind is cut off from God. There are two kinds of knowledge in the world, one is the knowledge that we teach in schools.  The other is knowledge that comes from God and it’s spiritual knowledge.  Carnal people only can relate to what he can see or learned and has obtained through the five senses; Christians have revelation from God which is spiritual that rises above the 5 senses so we are not limited.  The grave yard is filled with potential untapped power, dormant ability, hidden strength, used might, reserved power and unused success.  I find that people become victims of mental and historical conditioning. What we see, and what ever we hear are small things compared to what we think, because what we think interprets what we see and what we hear. Because you are limited to your 5 senses or the physical world, you never reach your destiny in this life, or your purpose. You never connect to the real source of your power which is used by faith, so you are powerless to change this world or make a difference in it. The greatest tragedy in life is not death, but it is life without purpose.  It is more dangerous to be alive and not know why then to be dead and not know life. Never under estimate the power of the mind, because you are a slave to whatever your mind is a slave to. You become conditioned to a way of thinking that you find yourself adjusting to the slavery of your thoughts, then your attitude begins to find comfort in oppression.  Sin is more than an act or a series of acts; it is a state or condition; it is that thought which lies behind and produces the acts. It blinds the understanding, corrupts the heart and alienates the mind from God. That's exactly why you are in the dark. Satan is also called the “power of darkness” and when we accept Christ we come out of darkness unto his light of wisdom. Darkness stands for ignorance; ignorance has ever been satan’s choice of weapon to keep people in bondage and unaware of his evil force in their life.  Not only has he bound them with ignorance, but he also has given them a "fear" of light so that they fight the truth (light force) that could set them free. (And Fear is the opposite of faith), Get Wisdom, Get Saved and Get real freedom.

text: So this movie (and the book it was based on) portray Revelation as a literal account of what will happen when Christ comes back.  If you look at the book of Revelation what it actually does is reveal the history of Israel and the Roman Empire from the first Century onwards.  The Bible predicted events such as the fall of the Roman Empire, the Byzantine and Turkish Empires, and even the French Revolution.  If you doubt the power of God, read Revelation.  It uses signs and symbols to depict religions, political powers and events.  Once you find out what they are symbolic of, you will truly see the awesome power and grace of God.

text: The Pretrib Rapture Jackpot!                by Bruce Rockwell       Attention, writers. You can make a fortune by promoting the pretrib rapture!      First, some background. As you know, pretrib began in Scotland in 1830. The earliest developers, including Edward Irving and John Darby, admitted that it was then a totally new view that had never been part of any church's theology.      They also admitted that it had suddenly sprung from only OT and NT "types" and "symbols" and not from any clear Bible statement!      As late as 1957, pretrib expert John Walvoord admitted in "The Rapture Question" (p. 148) that "pretribulationism" is NOT "an explicit teaching of Scripture"!      Since the early 1900s pretrib has been sold by novelists like Sydney Watson (in 1913) and by Salem Kirban whose "Left Behind"-type novel "666" came out in 1970 - the same year Hal Lindsey's "The Late Great Planet Earth" started breaking sales records.      The very first rapture novel titled "Left Behind" came from the joint pens of Peter and Patti Lalonde in mid-1995, resulting in some competitors being left behind.      The pretrib rapture view, which admittedly is only an "inference" and not "explicit," rests basically on verses in John 14, I Thess. 4, and I Cor. 15, none of which have either a "taken/left" separation or exciting, nail-biting scenarios that can "sell" pretrib.      You have to go to Revelation's action-packed chapters instead. When you do, you discover they can be tied to end time details found basically in the Olivet Discourse.      As you know, pretribs believe in two stages; Stage 1 is the pretrib rapture which supposedly occurs several years before Stage 2 which is the posttrib second coming to earth.      Since the three "rapture" chapters listed above don't have any clear rapture-type separation between the "righteous" and the "wicked," your best launching pad if you want to be a bestselling author is "the one shall be taken, and the other left" phrase in Matt. 24:40, 41 and Luke 17:34-36.      Trouble is, Dr. Walvoord and many other pretrib leaders declare that the "one taken" are the "wicked" taken in judgment while the "righteous" are left! But since the average pew-sitters don't seem to know this, you can easily convince them that the "one taken" is a sort of code for an any-moment pretrib rapture!      And the pew-sitters don't know that Walvoord etc. also teach that the same phrase is part of "non-imminent" Stage 2 which is posttrib (and not pretrib) and is on "Jewish" (and not "Church") ground!      In order to preserve and emphasize Stage 1 (the pretrib rapture), pretrib merchandisers in recent decades have been stretching forward various aspects found in Stage 2 and quietly applying them to Stage 1. Aspects include "the day of the Lord," "God's wrath," "the taken/left phrase," "the unknown day and hour," and Christ's coming "as a thief" (which is always tied to Armageddon and other posttrib events).      (For more on the above Google "The Correct Answer to Who's Taken" etc. on Joe Ortiz's blog of Apr. 12, 2010. Also Google "Pretrib Rapture Stealth.")      Yes, I've told you how you can turn yourself into a bestselling, wealthy author.      But unfortunately you have some competition because Tim LaHaye and Jerry Jenkins have already become opportunists and made millions of dollars that are destined to be left behind!      For more on them and their partners, Google "The 'Left Behind' Rupture," "LaHaye's Temperament," "Jerry Jenkins Apologizes for Being Seen Gambling in Casinos," "Pretrib Rapture Diehards," "Thomas Ice (Bloopers)," "Walvoord Melts Ice," "Famous Rapture Watchers," "Margaret Macdonald's Rapture Chart," "Pretrib Rapture's Missing Lines," "Roots of Warlike Christian Zionism," "Evangelicals Use Occult Deception," "Pretrib Rapture Secrecy," "Letter from Mrs. Billy Graham," "Pretrib Rapture Politics" and "Pretrib Rapture Dishonesty."      In closing let me say that Jeremiah 17:11 warns that "he that getteth riches, and not by right, shall leave them in the midst of his days, and at his end shall be a fool."      And you can bet on this! We are not called to cram the Bible down others throats and scream at them as soon as they state something that displeases you. We are only commanded to portray Christ by showing His love to others. Exodus 14:14 "The Lord will fight for you, and you have only to be silent." Proverbs 11:12 "Whoever belittles his neighbor lacks sense but a man of understanding remains silent." In conclusion, I would just like to encourage you all to drop all the insults and retaliation as soon as someone offends you and love one another as Christ commands us to. God Bless.

text: I have read some of your comments and I have to first apologize to those of you who have been wronged by those who confess Christ with their lips but their hearts are far from Him. Christians are not perfect but we like to stand in judgment as if we are. The key thing to bring away from the sacrifice of Jesus is that the sacrifice was far greater than the sentence.  Because of Adam's willful disobedience to God's commandment we were all sentenced to spiritual death, cut off from God. Man was held prisoner by the Law.  The Law was there to show us that we cannot live by the Law. It is impossible to follow the Law in its entirety. Jesus came as the second Adam to show us a better way.  He gave us the covenant of grace.  Grace cannot be earned. It is unmerited, undeserved, and unlimited favor. Remember because of sin we were spiritually dead. What can a dead man do to earn grace? Absolutely nothing.  There is absolutely nothing that you have done or could ever do that was not forgiven by Jesus' sacrifice.  As for the movie,  this is just one man's interpretation of the end times.  The bottom line is that Jesus is returning.  When?  Only the Father knows. What I do know is that the Bible says that everyone will hear the Gospel and be given the chance to respond to it before the end will come.  I hope this movie portrays a loving Father and not a spiteful God. Remember though God is holy and cannot abide sin. God's judgment is not on His creation, it is on sin. He provided a way out of this judgment through the blood of Jesus

text: I didn't want to enter the conversation because of all the bashing I hear back and forth, but I have to. I think about this all the time. I think about how amazing it is going to be when Jesus Christ the risen savior comes back to get His bride - the Church body of faithful, authentic believing Christians, who don't just say they believe but actually live like it and live under the Righteousness of Christ. But I also think about all those who don't know Christ and how terrifying and horrible it will be. I shudder at the thought of being left behind. It is nothing to laugh at or argue against. If you hear nothing else people hear this:  Christians: STOP arguing with others and START LOVING THEM. STOP trying to prove or argue that you are right. You know what the truth is. If you believe God, then you have to believe in Jesus and the Holy Spirit. Let HIM change both non-believers, luke-warmers and YOURSELF. YOUR JOB, our job is focusing on being responsive to the Holy Spirit's work of continuous SANCTIFICATION in us, our STEWARDSHIP of everything God gives us, and our SERVICE to others. This is what true believers should look like. Don't believe me? Look it up Matthew 25 - read it. The parables of the Bridesmaids, the Stewards and the Sheep. At the end of each parable, read what it says.. and then BELIEVE GOD and DO it, or you will be no better off than the unbelievers. Be changed by Jesus' love not prompted to bicker with those who don't yet know the truth. Educate them. Serve them. Love them. SHARE THE GOOD NEWS. Glorify God with your lives, not yourselves. He IS Risen and He will come back. Be ready - and know that each one of us will be accountable for how we've treated others, the conditions of our hearts. We are accountable.   ANYONE who might watch this and think "yeah right, that's stupid, Christians are whack" I understand. It seems totally foolish to you. But it's true. I'm not speaking for the accuracy or the "Christian" morality/theology of this movie since I haven't seen it yet, but one day rapture WILL happen and there will be people left behind and people who suffer and die because of people disappearing like this (as far as I know based on what the Bible says). I AM a Christian and I don't hate you or want bad things for you. I love what God loves. And God loves you. He gave His son Jesus in your place - because each of us is separated from a loving, perfect God - our heavenly father, because of sin. Our selfish choices to deny that He exists, that He's in charge, that He can do whatever He wants and He is always right because He made everything. We say "No thanks God, I'll do it may way, your way is stupid. Denying His very existence is a good example of this. He sent Jesus to die the death we deserve and separated him from God the way we deserve to be, and will be if we don't respond to Him. If this doesn't make sense.. Keep an open mind. Pray and ask God if He's real. He will answer.

text: The gathering of the saints WILL NOT HAPPEN until AFTER the son of perdition sits in the place of God. THERE IS NO PRE-TRIBULATION RAPTURE!!!  2 Thess 2:1-5 Concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our being gathered to him, we ask you, brothers and sisters,  not to become easily unsettled or alarmed by the teaching allegedly from us—whether by a prophecy or by word of mouth or by letter—asserting that the day of the Lord has already come. Don’t let anyone deceive you in any way, for that day will not come until the rebellion occurs and the man of lawlessness[a] is revealed, the man doomed to destruction. 4 He will oppose and will exalt himself over everything that is called God or is worshiped, so that he sets himself up in God’s temple, proclaiming himself to be God.  The harvest is THE END.  Matthew 13:39 The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.  Matthew 24:29-31  Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory. And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.  This movie, and the book series from which it is spawned, will be responsible for the eternal death of millions.

text: I can't say I am surprised that atheists are all over the comments section of a trailer they should have no interest in. I do have a question though. If what you believe is true, that we are all just descendants of chemical and mineral stardust then what are you doing here? Why does it matter that some would believe in a fairy tale if we all are nothing more than wormfood in the end? You might be able to spread a little doubt in someone who has gone to church, but you wont be able to turn anyone who has experienced Jesus in their life, and had him change them. We know that a life with Christ means we will be hated by those that we love and are trying to reach.   But what brings you here?   You are not convinced of what you believe. There is a part of you that knows you were made in God's own image, and that sin has brought you down. You come here for either reassurance through ridicule of those you call whacked, or you are looking for the truth. Here it is.   God was made flesh, he walked the earth, healed many, suffered and died paying the penalty for all sin, yours and mine. Rose from the dead and now lives, sitting at the right hand of the Father. His name is Yeshua, here we call him Jesus. He will return soon to this earth. Ask him to forgive you, and be Lord of your life. He is faithful to forgive.

text: God is real. He is real. And for you the atheist who says that the Bible is based on horrific and false events, well, you weren't there so you can't say anything. The only reason the Bible is horrific is because a whole bunch of sinners are in there. And the events that took place aren't false. You people may think that we transcribed from monkeys and that scientific evidence that you supposedly found, but it is all just rubbish. God is real. And so is the Devil.  For you of those who are just thoroughly confused on why everyone is fighting, well listen to this.  God is real. He made the world. He sent his own Son to die on the cross for our sins and I'm sure most people wouldn't dare do that considering because they are selfish. The rapture is when the church, aka Christians, is carried by God's angels up into heaven. After that, the tribulation will probably start either after or a day after this happens.  The tribulation is a very sad time of which many people will die. So I advise you to go to a church that doesn't have a false preacher and repent. For God said that the time is at hand and He showed us in the new testament the signs of His coming.  Wars and rumors of wars. Parent against child. Child against parent. The fig tree at summer. Which basically means when summer is near. Things about Israel. And others. They are all planted in the Bible.  Yeah you may or may not argue with me. And yeah you may be angry and decide to start trouble. But guess what. When you yourself are either burning in the depths of hell never to be opened again because God would've already created a new world, (I'm being serious. I'm not joking about hell.), or in the great tribulation, your going to regret that this ever happened.  And you may say, fine ill wait, or some snarky remark.  YOU DONT WANT TO WAIT. YOU DONT WANT TO BE ON A PLANE THAT IS CRASHING BECAUSE MOTHERS ARE FREAKING OUT BECAUSE THEY HAVE LOST THEIR BABIES. OR THAT THE PILOT OR COPILOT IS MISSING.  and you also may think, so? Caps don't scare me.  Well, it will when your facing it.  And sure you might not die on a plane. But either way your going to die.  Unless you regain your sins in the great tribulation. That will be when groups of Christians are walking to a mountain to see the great battle between God and Satan.  You see, now before the rapture happens, Jesus is like a blanket over earth. And after the Christians and the Church have descended into heaven, the blanket will come off and literally, all hell will break loose.  God does love you. He gave you the choice to be a Christian or a sinner. Literally, no one in their life goes along without some type of connection from God. No one. And if you say that you have, well, that's because you missed it. although, there will be chances where you have to search yourself.  God gave us rules so we wouldn't be robotic and without mistakes.  If we were perfect we wouldn't be able to make mistakes. God isn't a dictator of our lives, he is a leader. The president of the whole entire world.  So the reason that we aren't perfect, but perfect in His eyes, is because you need mistakes in life. So then you can learn from them and get a better understanding.  And I'm pretty sure my fellow brothers and sisters in Christ will support me in this.  God wrote this through me. Thank you God.  Wow, this is like an essay. I wrote for like an hour. Yeah, bye sinners. I'm going to watch the movie. :)

text: As deist, I believe in a god - but not that of any religion; but as a deist I am also a man of science and reason. I am also a former catholic. To the atheists and christians arguing, I have the following to say: To the christians; most non-believers were once, at a time, believers. They most likely left the faith not because they are evil or hate God - they left it because they had an inquisitive mind which inspired them to seek the truth. I'd hate to burst your bubble, but most atheists probably know more about written scripture and the history behind said scripture than actual believers. Although you may not understand them, they most likely understand you - because at one point, they were in your shoes. They left the faith because of their open mind and because they applied reason. The bible is not, by most accounts, reasonable or logically sound. Religion is that way in general - that is why it is referred to as *"faith"* Please stop preaching your junk as if it were truth - just because you feel the "holy spirit" and just because a thousand year old book says something doesn't mean it's true. If that's the case, you better tell me why other major religions are not true - without violating your own logic.   To the atheists. It is foolish to assume there is no God. Sure there isn't a celestial overlord/mystical space wizard, BUT what we come to know as "God" is rather relative. God doesn't have to be some super magical dictator - God can be the very laws of physics themselves. Or even the engine which drives the potential multiverse. IT most likely exists, but it all depends on what you define IT to be. As Carl Sagan suggested, atheism is a bit foolish (yall are jumping the gun.).  This is my opinion; as deist I can say I have the best of both worlds.

text: Genesis 9:8-16The Message (MSG)  8-11 Then God spoke to Noah and his sons: “I’m setting up my covenant with you including your children who will come after you, along with everything alive around you—birds, farm animals, wild animals—that came out of the ship with you. I’m setting up my covenant with you that never again will everything living be destroyed by floodwaters; no, never again will a flood destroy the Earth.”  12-16 God continued, “This is the sign of the covenant I am making between me and you and everything living around you and everyone living after you. I’m putting my rainbow in the clouds, a sign of the covenant between me and the Earth.   From now on, when I form a cloud over the Earth and the rainbow appears in the cloud, I’ll remember my covenant between me and you and everything living, that never again will floodwaters destroy all life. When the rainbow appears in the cloud, I’ll see it and remember the eternal covenant between God and everything living, every last living creature on Earth.”     We complain so much about evil in the world. You know in Genesis 9 God says His arm of justice is powerful and by a rainbow He vowed never to destroy the earth with water and so far He is faithful to His promise but one bad day evil people will taste His anger on evil.   One. Day.

text: They are hungry, brothers and sisters! Why do they flock to these pages and converse day after day with people they deem to be mentally inferior? They are searching! They insult us, belittle us, and take every opportunity to pick apart the truth--that is quite a lot of effort for something so "pointless"! Regardless, don't worry, brothers and sisters!  "Whatever happens, conduct yourselves in a manner worthy of the gospel of Christ. Then... I will know that you stand firm in the one Spirit, striving together as one for the faith of the gospel without being frightened in any way by those who oppose you. This is a sign to them that they will be destroyed, but that you will be saved—and that by God. For it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ not only to believe in him, but also to suffer for him..." Philippians 1: 27-28  "Do everything without grumbling or arguing, so that you may become blameless and pure, 'children of God without fault in a warped and crooked generation.' Then you will shine among them like stars in the sky as you hold firmly to the word of life." Philippians 2: 14-16  "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding." Proverbs 9: 10  To those who challenge the Almighty God, know that He warned us about you centuries ago: "The wrath of God is being revealed from heaven against all the godlessness and wickedness of people, who suppress the truth by their wickedness, since what may be known about God is plain to them, because God has made it plain to them. For since the creation of the world God’s invisible qualities—his eternal power and divine nature—have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that people are without excuse. For although they knew God, they neither glorified him as God nor gave thanks to him, but their thinking became futile and their foolish hearts were darkened. Although they claimed to be wise, they became fools..." Romans 1: 18-22  "Furthermore, just as they did not think it worthwhile to retain the knowledge of God, so God gave them over to a depraved mind, so that they do what ought not to be done. They have become filled with every kind of wickedness, evil, greed and depravity. They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit and malice. They are gossips, slanderers, God-haters, insolent, arrogant and boastful; they invent ways of doing evil; they disobey their parents; they have no understanding, no fidelity, no love, no mercy. Although they know God’s righteous decree that those who do such things deserve death, they not only continue to do these very things but also approve of those who practice them." Romans 1: 28-32  Repent for the Kingdom of Heaven is near!

text: Ok, both sides of this argument are being kind of rediculous right now so I'm going to throw my two cents in here. atheists- I don't quite understand how a random explosion that created everything from humankind and animals to mountains and oceans would be anymore logical than a god who created the world for a purpose. Fellow Christians- I'm pretty sure that God did not say go around and start saying "You atheists will feel the wrath of god, hahahaha."  Show kindness and compassion to people even when it seems like they don't deserve it. Atheists- A lot of you on here are complaining that Christians always push their beliefs on people who don't believe. Well, no one told you to comment your beliefs on a religious video. Therefore if you have a right to share your beliefs, or lack of, and call us Christians "idiots and retards," then we most definitely have the right to comment about our beliefs especially considering that this movie has to do with Christian faith. Fellow Christians- We need to stop being so argumentative. We need to say what God puts on our hearts and then just pray about it and let God do the rest. There's no point in getting flustered over people who are set in there ways, we need to let go and let God. Hatred and anger is just an excuse to ignore the fear of the unknown that is actually being felt.

text: Greg Sitter said:  "Most atheists do not claim that there is for sure no god. But we atheists don't believe in a god unless a god is 100% proven to be real."  My thought: I assume you mean "proven" to be in a way that conforms to modern science. The problem with that is that modern science only accepts in its proofs phenomena that are in the material world. So far, science has not been able to manipulate or detect energy whose vibrations are higher than those in the material world.  God can be detected in things of the spirit world. There has been plenty of work on Earth to demonstrate that other levels of energy do exist, but science refuses to bother to carry out experiments on this level of energy that are dependable and repeatable. The movement to prove Near Death Experiments to involve the spirit world is picking up. Science will only say "The Near Death Experience is a product of the physical brain. Period." —even though none of THEIR conjectures can be proven. The old saying is "Science progresses one funeral at a time." That means people hang on to their old beliefs until they die. Those old scientists will be dying off and you will see proof that there IS a spirit world. And along will come more and more evidence of God that people will be able to accept. This may not result in proof that a "Rapture" will occur nor that the Bible is literally true. And so even THIS source of real proof will probably not be accepted by Christian Fundamentalists. That's the way it is so that's the way it must be. People know that our real home is in heaven, and they must believe and follow in the way that feels right to them.  Me? I believe in God, and that our souls are eternal and we come back again and again to become wiser in the ways of God.  Read Michael Newton, "Journey of Souls," if you feel drawn to learning more!

text: QuantumGh0st....since you are an atheist, why are you even watching this trailer ?  You all the scriptures "inhumane".  You are quite right when you say that. The New Covenant which Jesus of Nazareth brought forth from his virgin birth, to his sinless life, to his willingness to die on the cross with all the world's sins on his shoulders both at his death and those sins to come throughout time until his return, then his resurrection on the third day and ascendance into Heaven. Jesus preached nothing but love and peace, but just because you are a member of the human race doesn't give you the 'pass go' card into the Kingdom of Heaven. God cannot nor will not be in the presence of sin, thus the scripture, "suffer the children and let them come unto me, for of such is the Kingdom of Heaven"....and we also get a warning, "broad is the path that leads to destruction and many there will be that follow therein, but narrow is the path and few there will be that makes it to Heaven"....God wants everyone to be in Heaven, but at a certain point in your life comes 'free will' and if you make the wrong choices and do not repent, you are lost brother, its just that simple. You can call God and His son Jesus names and think it unfair simply because you reason as a human. The God-Head (the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit) do not adhere to such simplistic humanistic thinking and reasoning. It's your choice brother. deny him and spend eternity with Lucifer. Accept Jesus, be baptized and live a Christian life and you'll live with God and the Son in such beauty where no tears are ever seen and even the laws of physics cease to exist. Please think about it, do not harden your heart, my words are sincere and are sent to you with a caring heart.  The time is growing near. The Bible says that "no man knoweth the hour or the day that the Son of Man shall return". But as sure as I'm writing this Jesus will return and take the innocent with him. After that, what happens on planet Earth is unspeakable in it's horror. Man is left along to his own devices and at that point all that is wrong with the human condition will be unleashed. Surely you don't want to be a part of the latter. Come with the Saints, its not too late. Again, soften your heart and mind. God is calling you home if you will only listen and accept him.

text: I have noticed a lot of cursing, other profanity, and absolute murderous hatred from the atheists posting here.  Do you think Christians fight against your atheism because they hate you? OF COURSE NOT! We fight to defend our faith because we believe it is beneficial for you--to be saved! We honestly believe what the Bible says, and the Bible has some pretty awesome things to say about people who believe in the true God. All we want for all mankind is to know God and make Him known. If you don't believe we're right, you can certainly say so, but say it with some maturity, not cussing and ridiculous insults. We Christians don't care about cursing or hatred of our fellow human beings, bashing them and spitting in their faces when we think their beliefs are wrong as others do. That's what many, many atheists do, especially against followers of Jesus for some reason. Instead of using the F-word and making yourself look like a blind internet thug who only cares about insulting religious people, why don't you atheists start explaining in mature, sensible words why you believe you are right. Let's stop the crazy hatred (and that goes for all Christians as well: no blind, crazy hatred and subsequent insulting remarks against others!) All this swearing and immature insulting is making me sick.

text: I'm a Christian, but I don't care for this type of movie. Here is why: One, MOST Christian denominations do NOT teach this idea of the Rapture. This idea of Rapture--of suddenly all the chosen few vanishing and going up to heaven---is universally debunked, rejected, and doubted by the VAST majority of Christian sects. Only a tiny minority of Christian sects preaches that the Rapture will occur.  Two, while I used to be a fan of Nicolas Cage many years ago, when he actually did some decent drama, these days the man will take a paycheck from ANYONE for ANY role. And, in action roles, Cage comes across as the same guy, over and over again. He's one-dimensional.  Heck, if you watched him in "Con Air", then watch him in THIS movie, it's the same whining, yelling, moaning man. He gets old, real fast. The man made only ONE great movie("Leaving Las Vegas") and most of the others are either annoying or mediocre.  One more thing: only ONE well-made movie about the concept of the Rapture has ever been done, and it was made back in 1991 with Mimi Rogers. I'll wager 90% of you have never seen it: it was called "The Rapture", and it was actually quite interesting. Parts are very riveting, and bizarre. It ends as a complete and utter downer, as it was intended. I recommend it as a decent rental, and it is an adult movie.

text: Prayers to all people with such comments as 'best day will be when christians are gone', 'this shows how absurd the Bible is', or 'your religion doesn't make any sense', etc.  You can believe and find salvation through Jesus, or you can let it fall on deaf ears. Regardless of your personal beliefs, views, and so on, that will not change Gods plan. And no matter how indifferent you feel toward God, He is still loves you and seeks you. It's just not as simple as deciding God isn't for you, or religion isn't your thing, it makes as little of a difference in God written word as me deciding the sky isn't blue because it just isn't my color, or water isn't wet because I think that is just crazy talk.  Oh, I know a good number of people will spew hate at my comments, but nonetheless, you have my prayers and I hope to see you in Heaven one day, despite the negativity or hatred, we are told to love our friends and enemies alike. God Bless.

text: Babies are pure, just like God/Jesus. Scripture in the book of Matthews tells us that, "unless we become pure in heart like children, then we won't enter the Kingdom of Heaven." Children don't know sin until their old enough to distinguish between what's good and what's evil. There are a lot of people that are ignorant to God's Love, and Purpose for our lives. He created man in His image so that we could have dominion over the Earth and give Him the Glory for His creation. We lost our power when Adam and Eve partook of the fruit in the garden (disobedient separated us from God). We regained our power when Jesus (The Way, Truth, Light, Perfect Sacrifice, Without Sin) died and resurrected for our sins. All we have to do is receive the FREE gift of Salvation by believing/ accepting Jesus into our hearts as Lord, and proclaiming with our mouth that He is indeed Son of God.   The great thing about God, is that he's giving you FREE WILL to either believe or don't believe. But regardless of what you believe, everything you choose in life had consequences (good and bad). Are you willing to gamble the destiny of your eternal soul to Hell, because you were too stubborn or arrogant to atleast find out who God is and what He wants for your life? Get to know God/Jesus first and completely before making your final judgment.   If God isn't real, then there wouldn't be life in man, plants, or animals. There's a spiritual warfare going on, and has been since the beginning of times. Stop letting Satan deceive you, and use to create war against God. And if you think neither God or Satan exists, then you've already been received. We wouldn't have to battle between love and hate, good and evil, light and dark, etc. As long as you still have breath, you still have a chance to find redemption with God through Jesus.  God bless!

text: I am believer in Christ and have believed for over 20yrs that there was to be a rapture and that God would save us from the great tribulation.  What got me to believe this is because I listened to the preachers, pastors and all who were of the cloth BUT I did NOT study the Word for myself - THAT WAS MY MISTAKE.  People as much as I wanted to believe this...there is no rapture.  I was devastated that I had believed a lie but elated that God found fit to show me the TRUTH in His Word.  For those that want the Truth and nothing but the TRUTH, please read Matt 24, Luke 21, Revelation chapters 6-18.  These passages give a clearly, sequence/order of events which shall soon take place on earth and they are from the very words of Jesus.  These events are prophesied throughout the entire Bible.  Daniel himself did not understand or could not even phathom what he saw when given th vision of the end times. (Read Daniel 11).  In Daniel's day/time God told him to seal up those things which he saw because they were not for his day..but were for the end.  Now we are in the end (Rev is the last book of the Bible) and NOW those things wgich were sealed can now be revelealed or understood correctly.  The fact of the matter is that YES those that are in Christ (whether dead or STILL alive) SHALL meet the Lord in the AIR. (1 Thess 4:13-18) But 1 Corinthians 15:50-53 tells us that we shall be changed at THE LAST TRUMP (Rev 19).  This is when the chucch (The Bride of Christ) meets Jesus (The Bridegroom) to get our glorified bodies so that  we can make a U-turn back to earth to rule and reign with Christ 1,000yrs (1000yrs = a day to God).  In other words, the Kingdom of God is at hand and it will be here on earth not heaven....which is why we are to pray in the manner Jesus told us to pray in Matthew 6:9-13.  THY KINGDOM COME IN/ON EARTH  not heaven.  There is no rapture but there is a place of safety.  Jesus said in Luke 21:36 to pray that we may be counted worthy to ESCAPE all these things which shall come to pass.  If there was a rapture, that would mean that God's ELECT (True worshippers) would not be here to experience the tribulation period. Right?  Well Matthew 24:22 states that the events that are soon to hit this earth, NO FLESH would be able to survive (that's how devastating these events will be)...BUT FOR THE SAKE OF THE ELECT...those days will not last a long time.  Its time the truth be told and take God at His every Word.  We are in time where nuclear bombs are being created to wipe out all humanity if possible.  Its just a matter of time.  Study and do not be deceived by people of position...Live by every Word that proceeds out of the Mouth of God.   If God only saved Noah and his family (8 people total) when he destroyed the earth with flood....then woe be unto them who will not heed His Word now (for this time earth will be destroyed by fire).  Just like in Noah's day - there was a place of safety (The Ark) provided to him and his family.  God will provide us the same safety (those that will obey Hiw Will)Isaiah 40:31, Rev 3:10-11, Rev 12, Daniel 12.  (Remember the church of God is always referred to as a "woman," because the true church is His Bride).  Some Christians will not enter the place of safety due to their lukewarm attitudes Rev 3:15-19 & Rev 12:17.  They must suffer and die in the tribulation to build character necessary to enter in the Kingdom of God so they can reign with Christ.  This tribulation period will last 3.5 yrs not 7yrs as some may have been told.  Keep researching the Scriptures and ask God for wisdom.

text: After seeing most of the comments on here, I now understand why Obama was re-elected for a second term. I am a Christian and am glad that I know the truth. If someone had the cure for cancer we would all want that person to share for our friends and family to be made well. We are all eternal creatures, and were created with choice. We all have the right to choose what we want to believe and how to live our own lives (A gift from God). So, live your lives... God loves you and wants you to live eternally with Him in heaven. Good works are not enough, being nice to others is not enough, religion is definitely not enough. True Christians, who have realized that they have sinned against God and have repented (turn from their own selfish way of living) now have a wonderful personal relationship with God, because they have excepted the sacrifice God gave to us through his ONLY Son, Jesus Christ! Jesus Christ died for our sins! He paid our debt and has made a way for the imperfect (all of us) so we can go to heaven when die (which we all will sooner or later). Now that is even better than any cure for any thing we might face in this life. It's the Christians job to share this Good New to a lost and Dieing world... In love. So we present what we know is Absolute Truth and you can decided what you want to do with this message of love for your eternal soul. You can except or reject what has been presented... Your choice.

text: I've seen the trailer and it's great viewing with excellent cinematography and CGI effects, along with the cast. But, What could have been better is easy to solve. Like all amateur screenplay writers, we believe the approach to a great intro is the foundation to grasping negative attitudes towards the movie. So, here's my idea:  If the World is going to end, one must consider the concept that there must be  central element that cause the reaction to demise, let's say "Ozone Layer Diminishes" which catapults the environment effects like Radiation which messes up the mechanisms of Worldly goods. I.E. - automobiles, airplanes, transportation systems, etc... Thus, we have catastrophic consequence for our Heroes. Then, mixing the Intro with starting the event from the World's event backwards to the present time.  So, The END OF THE WORLD is the beginning and the film unravels to the beginning which is the Present . . . Perhaps, people nowadays need a Villain so why couldn't they have used the Ozone monstrosity as the culprit. Cheers,  Have  great time watch the movie, DMCjr.

A huge amount of intelligence isn't needed to open up a peaceful forum to talk about what you think and then respect what others think. I'm sure you expect others to respect your thoughts as well. It really isn't all that hard. To go out of your way to start insulting something out of the blue shows several levels of instability and discomfort that the subject causes anyways. If one truly believes what he is saying, he doesn't need to get all worked up and insulting. You must not believe everything that you are trying to prove. Just have an intelligent, insult free discussion is all I'm saying really. Regardless of the side. Especially if you expect to be taken seriously.

text: The bible talks about killing, being killed, sex, rape, pain, lust, drugs, and tons of other stuff that's just plain awful...you can sit there and talk as much crap on everything bad that the bible says...but do you actually take the time to read it..and how it talks about all these things being wrong..things that we all know are wrong! And how to cope and steer clear of that? And how the bible also teaches love and honesty and being the best person you can be! And how no matter what, if you ask for forgiveness the. You are givin it...have you ever screwd up so badly that you beg for that person to forgive you and they won't...and you sit and cry and feel hurt for that...guess what...God will...and he will love you as a loving parent would...but with much more intensity and understanding then any human mind could comprehend...some Christians are too condescending and righteous to even stand...but there are others out there who are as human as anyone else, who make mistakes and admit them like anyone else, and who love with such unconditional love that you can't feel anything but happiness when your around them...just because we Christians believe in something most of you don't, it doesn't give us a right to shove it down your throat, just like it doesn't give you a right to bash and hate on us so much. We all equally sin...and just cuz some of us try hard to mend our wrongs, and our reasoning is because we were taught to fix our mistakes based on not only our right mindset which we required for our God, the one we believe and trust fully! But also the fact that all our lives we have learned right from wrong, through a book you all consider "stupid" and "hateful" but most of us consider honest, and true and probably the realist book with the most real stories you will every read, that deal and address the most REAL things you can ever read. Just know this...we can "preach" to you all we want but it won't make you believe what we do...just like you can bash on us all you want and it won't make us not believe what you don't...just know we aren't going anywhere.

Easily Nicolas Cages worst movie ever and Nicolas Cage is Nicolas Cage. The start of this movie was similar to having the ugliest human to ever walk the earth take an explosive dump in my eyes after binging on burritos and dried fish flakes, the ending was like having that human take another equally offensive dump in my mouth, NO SIR, I do not want more. There is one positive though, we finally have a cure for Ebola, I hope patients can withstand the high levels of visual toxicity.  All in all, I give this movie 5 stars out of the entire universe, could've received 6 with broken washing machines.
author: The Fixer

text: I don't know whether this film was intentionally moronic and hilarious to satirise the nature of the subject matter, but it is one of the most truly awful films I've ever seen and I rarely ever say that about films I personally dislike, because in one way or another, I can accept it might simply not be my taste. In this case it is just lumpy mind vomit, everything about it from the kooky acting, the daytime soap opera soundtrack, absurd action moments, the condescending stereotypes that were 'left behind' and Cage's ever curious hair style. 0/10 The only reason I sat through it was to see who the writer would let 'redeem' themselves. The resulting message of the film is as loathsome, shallow and disgusting as the people who believe in a purile half-inched brained sentiment such as *"We get to go to Heaven and you don't! Nah, ne, nah, ne, nah, nah!"*    Spoiler: Who would have guessed the level headed Muslim and the nerdy guy who believes in aliens get 'left behind'. I'd rather spend damnation with these fellows, at least the woman still had some blow on her, I think I'll go talk to her.

text: I feel like 80% of the comments on this trailer didn't actually watch the movie but based their opinion (regardless of side) based just on the subject matter. This was not James Cameron's Left Behind. As an Agnostic, I think they did a good job of making a movie based on the concept of rapture without being preachy. It wasn't the best movie in the world, Cage resembled a B list actor in it (which I don't think was his fault, this wasn't his type of movie)  Generally speaking, this was just a disaster/survival movie. The main actress, if not a certified Atheist, was whole heartedly Anti-God, even when faced with the realization of Rapture. It actually made her despise him more. At the end, no one turned religious. No one decided they all needed to repent to be saved. No one started a cult to make amends to God.   Most of the movie revolved around Cage's flight and how to get home. While they tried to imply sequels at the end, who knows how preachy those might get, but for now this wasn't a terrible Sci-Fi survival film.

Millions of people were led astray when the Left Behind novels first came out and even more so when the films were made, the fact that it is being remade again by Hollywood only means even more people will flock to the cinema believing or wanting to believe this grand fable. And the fact that people don't read their Bibles but would rather lean on what others say doesn't make it any easier. My fear is that this idea of a pretribulation rapture will leave many people feeling lost and possibly reject God when its realization doesn't come to fruition. The sad thing is that's probably what satan wants. Moreover, this idea instills even more skepticism in those who are non-believers and might/might not be searching for the truth. The God I know is merciful and loving, He is a God of order and I don't believe for one second that He would cause the kind of chaos portrayed in this film

text: I've seen a LOT of movies and honestly this was the most offensive movie I've ever seen. I think it creates a new genre called "Christian God-Porn" where it basically acts as one big love-fest for the Christian version of the invisible man in the clouds who is watching and listening to everyone. It's a very long and expensive commercial for the fairytale religious people choose to believe in!!  I don't mind if movies like this are made, I don't believe in censorship, however I think it should come with a warning note at the start of the movie to let people know what they are about to watch is a Christian movie. That way if you're offended or not interested in such things, you have the choice whether to watch it or not. By the time I realized I was watching a Christian movie it was too late, I'd watched most of it already. I hoped there would be some kind of twist or something at the end, but there wasn't.    Unless you're a Christian or you don't mind watching a Christian movie, stay away from this, it's horrible.  I felt dirty after watching it.  That's my honest opinion.   Please don't attack me for that opinion if you're Christian, remember, you are entitled to your opinion and I am entitled to mine - I am not attacking anyone for any religious Christian comments and opinions here, so please don't attack me for mine.   I'm not necessarily an Atheist by the way, I'm just honest in saying that I don't know what's out there. However, I don't believe in any religion and nor do I want to watch some kind of Christian Propaganda film - or a propaganda film for any religion.  I feel tricked into it to be honest because nowhere on the cover does it say it's a Christian movie, I didn't spot a Jesus Fish or Cross on the cover.....  I should have read more about it before watching it, obviously. If I had known this was Christian God-Porn I never would have watched it.

text: What the heck ? This is not how the "Rapture" will work... :D In fact you will and could NEVER find the word "Rapture" in the Bible :D I'm a Christian and I know that the Rapture Theology was popularized in the 1820s-1830s by John Darby.  Matthew 13:24-30 ...'Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field: But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way. But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also. So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares? He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up? But he said, Nay; [NO] lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them. Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together FIRST the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.'  Oh look, We will meet AT the Harvest, not the Tribulation. AT THE HARVEST. Rapture theology is only really popular in America, which is pretty funny for a Christian. I mean, there's most likely an issue with this theory if America is looked at as "weird" by other Christians in the world. This is NOT Biblical. Keep in mind that the Bible also uses imagery if wondering what the FINAL Hope is for a Believer. This. Movie. Is. No. Where. Near. Biblical. :D Thank You :) Love You Guys :)

text: God isn't going to put up with this mess much longer...  Acts 17:31 [But] has set a day in which He will judge the world in righteousness through a Man whom He has appointed, having furnished proof to all men by raising Him [Jesus] from the dead."  1 Thessalonians 5:9 [Yet] God has not destined us [who believe] for wrath, but for obtaining salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,  Who will come and get us before the wrath of God descends on upon the Earth, even upon those who having refused God's gift of salvation... still have an outstanding debt of death with God. But as for those who are ready, having already died to this World He will collect unto Himself...  Isaiah 26:20 Come my people, enter into your chambers, and shut thy doors behind you: hide yourself as it were for a little moment, until the My wrath has past...  I've been Pre-Trib and no Rapture.... but today lean heavily towards a Pre-wrath Rapture of those who are ready and waiting for His return.  Yet these are not salvation issues, but accepting or rejecting Christ's payment for sin is... because after death comes the judgement...  Hebrews 9:27 it has been appointed for men to die once, after which comes the judgment:  Malachi 3:16-17 16 - Then those who fear the Lord spoke with one another, and the Lord listened attentively; A record book was written before him of those who fear the Lord and esteem his name. 17 - They shall be mine, says the Lord of hosts, my own special possession, on the day when I take action. And I will have compassion on them, as a man has compassion on his son who serves him.  Regardless if this movie is scripturally based or not [probably not] it is certainly time to get right with the Lord.

text: Seriously?  Left Behind is a book series that died YEARS ago and for good reason. It got everyone in this apocalyptic mindset and everyone was sure the rapture was going to happen any moment so the books flew off the shelves. Now everyone treats Left Behind like it was a one night stand that no one really wants to acknowledge or remember. Honestly, if they wanted people to come see this movie they should have picked up a little farther on in the series.  From a fictional standpoint, it is a very good idea for a film if its done right which from the trailers and reviews I'm certain they didn't.  Its just the classic disaster film that everyone has seen already. The real story picks up in the later books when Nicolae Carpathia drops his facade and assumes the role of the antichrist freely. True, in the books it jumps to the areas of ridiculousness fairly often that only the die hard fanatic took as truth instead of entertainment. Personally, I feel that Christianity has many unexplored opportunities to become Hollywood Blockbusters. I've been waiting YEARS for a movie based off of Paradise Lost. If done right a movie about the war in heaven and Lucifers fall could be EPIC. Far better than these disaster movies that are put in our faces over and over. Honestly, if they expected us to take Left Behind  seriously they shouldn't have cast Nicolas Cage as Ray Steele. But then I know that was done because he's the only celebrity crazy enough to actually take the role.
author: James Hallock

text: Anyone can see that we are heading towards a one-world system and government. This was predicted in the Scriptures of the Bible during a time when it was un-thinkable! The only way nations will give up their independence, willing to be led by an outside global government, is when all of the world somehow ends up in the same boat of a terrible calamity. Many global organizations are already in place: WHO (World Health Org.); World Bank; World Trade Org.; United Nations with its own military; Interfaith Church etc. But how can the devil run a world system through a man called the anti-christ?(1Jn.3; 2Jn.1:7) First of all, he needs control. With modern technology (satellites etc.) all this has become an easy task. Facebook, Twitter; cellphones, and cameras at every street corner are great tracking devices and also give any government a clear picture of who you are, where you live and who you might oppose. The final device, used to achieve total control, will be the RFID chip, implanted under the skin (see You Tube). A horrific disaster striking all of the nations at the same time will cause them to look for someone to lead them out of their troubles. Even secular Hollywood producers have envisioned such an event with a meteor threatening to destroy the earth, or some alien invasion coming upon us. One thing that all of the nations on earth have in common are Christians. The disappearance of them would cause horrific disasters, putting the whole world into the same boat of major distress. (see Matt. 24:40-41; John 14:1-3; 1Thes.4:16/17) 	However, I believe not all who call themselves Christians will be gone, taken up into the clouds. (1Thes.4:17) Those who have only made a half-hearted commitment, sitting on the fence while adding a little bit of Jesus to their worldly lifestyle, might be left behind. But since these “lukewarm” Christians (Rev.3:16) know the truth, they then will jump off the fence, now pursuing Christ whole-heartedly. And they will also be the ones who will bring in the unprecedented end-time harvest of countless souls. The time of the disappearance (rapture) of millions of Christians world-wide will initiate the forming of a one-world system with the antichrist as it's leader. This antichrist, empowered by satan, will be able to perform miraculous signs, and his charismatic personality will far surpass that of all of the world leaders of the past combined. His speeches will be hypnotizing, and with today's modern technology he will be able to address the whole world. Seeing is believing. When we can see that ancient prophecies are unfolding exactly as foretold, we can believe that there is indeed a spiritual, unseen world. As much as God is real, so also the devil!

text: So when the rapture happens, what happens to fetuses in the womb? Do they get raptured? At what point of development do they qualify for being raptured? Do they count when they're a zygote? What about fully developed babies at the moment of being born? Will they be raptured as they leave the womb? What about the belief that a newborn goes to hell unless they are baptized? Or are they 'safe' due to innocence?  What about children then? At what age does your god determine they are no longer 'innocent' enough to be raptured? Is there a specific hour, minute, second?  Why is it that everyone that I've asked has a different idea of what would happen? They claim they know the truth, and yet everyone has something different to say. If the truth is so inconsistent, how can we think of it as true at all? You may go back to the bible and say that it is the word of god and thus true, which is a circular argument. Harry Potter would not be true if it claimed it was true.  The bible is not considered a reliable source. Since any particular source my be fabricating their story, multiple independent sources are usually required for confidence. Establishing the lack of author biases, including religious motivations, is also necessary if a work is to be read at face value. The Bible satisfies none of these requirements.  Not to mention there are various contradicting passages (2 different creation myths, Genesis 1:1-2:3 and Genesis 2:4-25), many examples of human rights violations (Judges 19:25-28, where a man sends out his concubine to an angry crowd, where she is brutally raped, and he hardly acknowledge the fact), an astounding lack of evidence for a global flood, of Herod's slaughter of the innocent (Matthew 2:16–18), of the dead rising and roaming Jerusalem (Matthew 27:52-53, you would expect for there to be first hand accounts of such an extraordinary event, but there is nothing outside of the bible that mentions it), and there has been no evidence for the 10 plagues in Exodus. The list goes on.

text: All of this can be traced back to the fact that humans tend to be more inclined to that which is emotionally appealing. You see, people are very easily lulled into a false sense of confidence. Anything that can manipulate their emotions, while simultaneously taking advantage of their ignorance to appear logical and convincing, can captivate masses of people. Religion has perfected this technique. Not only does it ensure that its "values" are past on through the generations by means of child indoctrination, it also takes advantage of emotionally vulnerable people with nonsense propaganda such as this movie, all while making a quick buck in the process. ( Because if you're gonna fool billions, why not make the best of it? )  As Karl Marx put it: "Religion is the opiate of the masses."

text: No Fundamentalists you won't escape the persecution to come...  Unfortunately the Rapture is poor theology going back only about 100 years.  There was no rapture for the first 3 centuries of brutal Christian persecution nor in the subsequent centuries that followed.  You can't get to Easter Sunday until you go through Good Friday.   Christ said we have a cross to bear and that we too must drink from His cup of suffering.   St Paul says "he makes up for what is lacking in the suffering of Christ."  Everything Christ went through His Church will too.  Including persecution and resurrection.  Christ didn't suffering and die so we wouldn't have to, He sanctified it, made it an act of self-donation and love that we are called to imitate His example.  By uniting our suffering and the crosses Jesus puts in our life to His we fulfill God the Father's plan as adopted sons and daughters of God.  No Fundamentalists you won't escape the persecution to come and its foolish pride to think so when all your Christian Brothers and Sisters bared the cross before you, you are not more special then they were.  As a matter of fact they will be more highly blessed in Heaven for living a life so close to our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.

text: SPOILER ALERT! STOP READING IF YOU HAVEN'T WATCHED THE MOVIE YET: The movie is not as horrible as the ratings and scores given. It's by no means a great movie but it's definitely not a bad one either! Anyhow, in the movie the good and practicing Christians in addition to all children are taken to heaven by God, however, there is what seems to be a practicing and good Muslim stuck on the plane with the sinners, blasphemers and non-believers! This is very interesting, because whoever made the movie thinks that Muslims don't believe in God and therefore have no place in heaven.  Just for the record, Muslims do believe in God and not some random deity that they call "Allah" as most non-Muslims think, they actually believe in the same God of Christianity and Judaism, and the literal translation for the commonly used Arabic word "Allah" -or more accurately "Al Lah"- in English is "The God" where "Al" translates to "The" and "Lah" translates to "God", even Arab Christians use the word "Allah" to refer to God BTW.  Generally speaking and without going into details, Islam as a belief, has more commonality with Christianity than difference, and if you don't buy what I stated because of a perception or prejudice, you can Google it and find out for yourself.  End of lecture! I just had to take this off my chest!

text: All I know is that none of us knows what the hell happens to us when we die because none of us has been dead and also been able to communicate what happens. I know that I'm not afraid to die, but I hope it's a peaceful death. I am curious as to what happens afterwards though. There are many theories like we go to Heaven/Hell, we're reborn as someone/something else or whatever other theories there are out there. I would like the idea of a peaceful afterlife as anything we wanted, or the idea that when we die, we know everything about everything. Reincarnation even sounds ok, depending on what we come back as and if we even remember the life we're currently in now in our next lives. I'm saying all this to say don't bash other people for thinking that something like heaven or reincarnation, or nothing will happen to us in the afterlife. Who are we to say that people are gullible for thinking that would happen when none of us has experienced it before? It's like as soon as one of these theories get made into a movie, it's automatically deemed 'not real'. Who knows what will happen in the future? Don't be the person bashing an idea that might actually happen. Just sayin'.

text: I pray that God will open your eyes and see some of your people to the truth.  I can't force you to believe in God.  That's up to God.  But I can try and convince you that God loves you and he wants the best for you by believing in Him.  There's this talk of how you have to do good things to go to heaven.  That's not true at all.  That means that you couldn't sin for the rest of your life here on Earth just to go to heaven.  That is not humanly possible.  For it says in the Bible there is not one person on Earth that hasn't sinned.  Then why God sent himself to Earth in human form, Jesus Christ to save us from our sins.  That way when we give our faith to God and repent, he sees Jesus in us, the perfect person that died for us on the cross.  Don't wait to repent to God for we do not know when Jesus is coming back to take those who believe in him.  We do not know when the Rapture will happen, as the apostle Paul says in the Bible that the Rapture will happen in the twinkling of an eye.  But we must be ready for when He does come.  Please do not wait until after the Rapture for there are dark times predicted in Revelation.  After Jesus comes back to save his church, God will still give you a second chance to believe in him.  If the Rapture does not make you believe in Him, the Judgements predicted in the Bible will.  May God bless each and every one of you.    =)

text: Belief bashing has gone on forever so have one or more corrupting The intent of a message for power and greed. So what is at fault the message or the ones who corrupted it for power or to feed one's ego? we all have faith in something. The atheist Has faith in science and the seen world.The people who believe in God believe in the seen world and the unseen world.  Science once thought the world was flat we know this is not true. But yet at one time it was professed To be true. Till one day someone had faith it was not flat and sailed across the oceans. Religion and faith are two different things one can exist without the other. We can't see the wind but we can see it's actions.  Such is faith we can't see it but we can see it's resulting actions.   What ever guiding faith one has it comes with a personal responsibility  Jesus said seek and yee shall find. Meaning we have a responsibility to do some work not sit and do no research ourselves.  History is forever being rewritten as new discoveries are made. Sunken cities off the coast of India and Cuba . Ancient cities found all over the world that can shed light on ancient writings.   Point being a person who has faith in God or Jesus while being a scientist or teacher can be just as sane as a atheist in the same professions.  The message is the message who and how it's corrupted  is another story.

text: If there is no God, if there is no judgement or afterlife, why are you guys so enraged at this films message and so passionately opposed to the concept of there being a God. I don't suppose you were this opposed to LOTR or Guardians Of The Galaxy....  This is because you were born with a moral compass called a conscience. Even though your conscience is seared, it still screams out of the silence within that there is a God and that you are so far from Him. So instead of acting upon it, you inadvertantly choose to ignore it, and to mock and silence anything that testifies to this truth.  The truth is you are guilty of sinning against a Holy God. You are not the good person that you have convinced yourself that you are and so you are in trouble with a Holy and Just God. GOOD NEWS - Jesus paid the debt that you couldn't pay. He suffered and died on your place so that you don't have to.  He took your punishment for you.  So all you have to do is accept that Jesus died for you, and allow Him to come into your life by His Spirit to guide and lead you and you will be saved.  This won't be an easy life, it will be difficult. The greatest difficulty is facing the fact that you have got it so wrong. Allow Jesus in. Accept His free gift of life today.

text: 23% of the Bible is prophetic, meaning, foretells to us what is going to happen before it happens, to 100% accuracy. That is indisputable, no matter what anyone believes. Manuscript experts attest to the Bible's reliability and authenticity. That is, even non Christian experts. The further one digs into the Bible, or seeks to demolish its veracity, the inevitable begins to dawn. Just ask Ivan Panin Russian mathematician, or CS Lewis, Newton, Einstein, Pascal, Boyle, Faraday, Kepler, Galileo, Copernicus, Descartes, Kelvin, Max Planck (quantum theory) and Bacon, who is quoted as saying: "It is true, that a little philosophy inclines man’s mind to atheism, but depth in philosophy brings men's minds about to religion; for while the mind of man looks upon second causes scattered, it may sometimes rest in them, and go no further; but when it beholds the chain of them confederate, and linked together, it  'excels toward' Providence and Deity."  If you saw the movie and wonder why tragedy culminates toward the end of human history, you will learn from study of the Bible that God is out of this world patient, not willing anyone should perish, but that everyone come to repentance and inherit from Him, eternal life, through faith in Christ.  God's character includes justice, holiness and mercy. God cannot allow injustice to prevail and inevitably reign, without eventual intervention (patient). God does not tolerate sin because he is holy. Sin cannot abide or even coexist in the presence of God because it would be burned up by holiness. Mercy - God does not leave us in condemnation through exacting perfect justice, in accordance with his holy character, but rather gives us all the gift of forgiveness through the substitutionary death (satisfies justice for wrongdoing) of Christ for our sins. In a sense, we don't go to hell for our sins, but rather our rejection of Christ. We all have a choice to believe in Christ's work on the cross, or reject him, and let pride and arrogance get in the way of God's attempts at reaching us with his truth, and the demonstration of his love. He could have just written us off and started over completely with creation, but 'God is love.'

text: The Theory (from Wikipedia) : Dispensationalism is a Christian evangelical, futurist, Biblical interpretation that believes that God has related to human beings in different ways under different Biblical covenants in a series of "dispensations," or periods in history.  As a system, dispensationalism is expounded in the writings of John Nelson Darby (1800–82) and the Plymouth Brethren movement,[1]:10 and propagated through works such as Cyrus Scofield's Scofield Reference Bible. The theology of dispensationalism consists of a distinctive eschatological end times perspective, as all dispensationalists hold to premillennialism and most hold to a pretribulation rapture. Dispensationalists believe that the nation of Israel is distinct from the Christian Church,[2]:322 and that God has yet to fulfill his promises to national Israel. These promises include the land promises, which in the future world to come result in a millennial kingdom and Third Temple where Christ, upon his return, will rule the world from Jerusalem[3] for a thousand years. In other areas of theology, dispensationalists hold to a wide range of beliefs within the evangelical and fundamentalist spectrum.[1]:13  My Comments : The Church is the Body of Christ. This then, is the Third Temple. So, when antichrist shows up, these 'left behind' theologians will no doubt say, "Look, Jesus".
