text: The biggest problem with American Christians is that they have been lied to for so long they don't even know what to believe. The King James version of the Bible is so full of mistranslations it should not be considered the "official" word of God. Just a few of the problems with it are, 1) The Sixth Commandment is "Thoe shalt not murder." The penalty in the Bible for murder is death, by the hand of MAN shall a murder be put to death, he shall be killed. So no True Christian should be against the death penalty for murderers, if they are they are opposing the word of God. 2) The Old Testament is the Hebrew Torah and should have little meaning to Christians, because Jesus gave us the New Testament and the new covenant with God. 3) Jesus never said that a persons sexual orientation has anything to do with Gods love for you. Leviticus spoke against homosexuality but he also spoke against eating shell fish but I don't see Christians protesting Red Lobster restaurants. Most of the teachings of Leviticus were health issues for people living in the desert. Read Leviticus and see how many of his teaching you are breaking before you go about hating gay people. 4) Homosexuality was seen as distracting men from fathering children, thus weakening the tribe. In an agrarian society, more children to share the work load was a good thing so anything that got in the way of that was viewed as bad. Most modern men confuse homosexuality with pedophilia even though gay men are just as outraged at pedophiles as straight men are. Again, Jesus never taught that homosexuals would go to Hell. 5) There is NO pre-tribulations rapture of Christian. All you Christians will go through the persecutions of the anti-Christ just like the rest of us poor souls, so get over yourselves. 6) Lilith is the first wife of Adam and was created at the same time, her strong will and refusal to submit to Adam's wishes led to her being caste out. Lilith was caste out of the Garden for the sin of seeing herself as Adam's equal, not as his servant. Eve was created later to be weak of will and so failed to resist Satan's temptations, Lilith would not have failed. 7) The Bible was not meant to be taken literally, it is an attempt to explain the world to primitive and uneducated people in such a way that they can understand it. The Old Testament was heavily influenced by the early Hebrews racist and self centered view of the world. There are many lessons in the Bible on how NOT to act toward your fellow man. 8) American Christians have been kept in a constant state of fear by conmen and liars, who have preached end times dogma for decades. Even though the Bible says no one can know the hour of Christ return, these conmen say otherwise. They are false prophets and should be tarred and feathered. 9) Creationism is an attack on our God given ability to reason and should be rejected. God works on large time scales, the size and age of the Universe proves that.  The conmen are so afraid to be called out that even as Christians die in the middle east, they do nothing to help. No money flows from American Christians to their brothers in Lebanon or even Bethlehem, the conmen keep it all to themselves. No outrage as Coptic Christians are beheaded, no call to arms to defend Christian communities and Churches that date back to the time of Christ. From Christians there is silence, confusion, and fear. How the Devil must laugh.  These are just a few of the problems confronting True Christians as we struggle to maintain our faith from attacks from without and within the Christian community.

text: I think that I am a bad uncle. I just bought Left Behind. My little buddy was begging me to let him watch it. I told him that he wouldnt like it it was for adults. Well finally I put it in. I thought that after a few minutes he would get bored with it and ask me to turn it off. Well he didnt. He kept on asking me whos that where is she going where is he going where is that guy going. I told him thats Rayford thats Cloie thats that guy is Buck. He is going to London. He is going to london. She is going to see her mommy. What happened to her mommy? Nothing happened to her mommy shes just been away at school. Oh I go to school too. Well it came to the scene where the rapture happened. My little buddy was like what happened to that little boy. At first I didnt want to answer him. How the heck do you explain that to a little kid without him being scared of God? He kept on asking so I finally told him that God took all of the Christians to heaven. I hope I didnt make him scared of God. I asked him if the movie was too scary and if he wanted me to turn it off. At first he said no its not too scary. After a few minutes he said that yes it was too scary he wanted to play a game.

text: To all atheists: look at at nature and think with your heart. Deep down you know that you are different than an animal. If not, your opinions, your life, or your desires and hopes don't matter. I am a scientific person. Even though I can't prove God exists, I believe love, life, and individuality matter so I CHOOSE to believe God exists. I was an atheist once. But the truth was I didn't want to be held accountable for my life. I wanted to do what I wanted to do. I wanted to make my own destiny. Is that not the allure of FREEDOM? Is that not my right? I found out that it is not. In this world freedom is an illusion. We are all bound by something. It is either someone something or mostly themselves. Do we not want to keep ourselves happy? Do we not want pleasure? We were created. Who knows what we want and desire than our Creator? Yet we want to do things our way. God loves you and me very much. That is why he will not let go of you. HE will prove to you he exists through people, events in your life and even this post. Me writing all this was set by God for you to read and understand him better. Nothing tells a kid his parents don't love him than when they let him do what he wants. Because God CARES he disciplines and ALLOWS bad stuff to happen but the root of it is humanity's stubbornness to ignore God so God will turn the heat up. Eventually he will prove he exists when he stands in front of you in the apocalypse or in judgement day when you die. I have researched over and over and God does exist. Man cannot prove he exists but he most certainly can't prove he doesn't. In science everything has a cycle. Beginning to End. Only one source in the entire world offers complete information about the cycle of the world with 100% accuracy so far and that is the BIBLE.  Is it not " innocent until proven guilty" so why don't you guys acknowledge Gods existence until you can prove he doesn't? God has nothing to prove. He created everything you have experienced and humanity's lifetime is like a novel to him yet your feelings and hopes matter to him because he loves you so much. We are his children whether we we want to or not. We can accept him or reject him and dare him to prove his existence. But once he does, you will NEVER be the same.

text: Wow! I've just finished watching this movie on TV. I'd never even heard of it before, and now I understand why. It just has no saving grace at all. Seriously bad acting, a pathetic storyline, badly directed, badly edited, really crap special effects, and so many continuity errors. Even the extras were third rate.  It now seems so churlish compared with everything else, but the first thing that struck me after the bad acting, was the idea of a transatlantic flight from JFK to London... with just TWO cabin crew! LMAO. And even one of those decided not to hang around too long. Genuinely one of the worst five movies ever made in my opinion.

text: There are three scholarly books examining the somewhat adequate evidence that the Flavian Emperors of Rome hired the turncoat Flavius Johsephus (he did such good work the Emperors even let him use their family name!) to forge the Gospels as propaganda against the militant Jewish uprisings. I sure you've noticed how easy that story goes on Rome and kind of shoves everything off on the Jews when Jesus was supposed to be Jewish. And the account they give is pretty calm considering Palestine was in open warfare with Rome at the time. Odd that nobody considers that. But then again, people have certainly been encouraged, if not outright coerced, to believe without question. I would think that even if you were really down with the story you might think the prophecies had been fulfilled when King Baldwin I, who believed himself of direct descent of the Line of David, established the Kingdom of Heaven in Jerusalem on December 25th, 1100 CE. Baldwin himself certainly did. Add that thinking the world is suddenly going to end at any minute is a common symptom of schizophrenia and you get... what? Hey, there are a lot of members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints that believe that the Mountain Meadow Massacre never happened; but I've read the trial transcripts. It happened. But, in America you have the freedom to follow whatever false religion you fancy, as long as your not a Branch Davidian, of course - and I'm sure all religious people will agree that every one but their own is indeed false. At least though, try to have fun with yours and don't use it to beat up other people, OK?

text: I think I liked the original (Kirk Cameron) version better (though I have not seen this one) - primarily because of the camera work (cinematography?) :  There is this subtle theme in that movie, the way the space is framed - you really get a sense of Urban space, and space in general, from claustrophobic airplanes, to the desolation of a "large" empty house (because persons are missing).  There is this one scene where this soldier in a jeep points a gun at him, and tells him to go inside, because a curfew is in effect.  Neither soldier gets out of the jeep. There is this space, and the houses are behind him, as he stands there on the street.  So, the effect is one of - there is government, but at the same time, there is not.  They drive away.  He stands there, staring.  You really got this sense of people versus government (imaginary, and real).  Have not seen this movie, but I thought the original was brilliantly filmed.  There is this one scene where you see a dog, with a leash, but no owner - that was funny - evidence that dogs do not go to heaven. .. That said, it is not wise to mix water (Scripture) with wine (Art), but .. sometimes, there is nothing else on... Think of a children's play in school - that may help keep fiction separate from TRUTH.. water apart from wine.

text: It's a real shame many comments here are rude and mean against the Christian faith.  It is also a shame that Vic Armstrong and thee filmmakers do not understand what the Holy Bible teaches. The whole "left behind" premise is completely unBiblical. Jesus in Matthew 24 clearly tells us the saved (real followers of Christ) will go through the great tribulation and will be persecuted, hunted down and killed for their faith. The book of Revelation clearly teaches this too.  There is a rapture (which means to be taken away) but it is also clear when this happens and who sees it, 1 Thessalonians 4:13-16 speaks of it...And tells us all the world will se e him. After this, the world does not just go on and planes to dot fall from the sky, the entire world will go in to judgment.  For the people here claiming "If God sends people to hell even if they're good then he's a monster" are wrong. Again, go and actually read the Bible, that clearly tells us "for the wages of sin is death" and "all have fallen short of the glory of God." In other words, no matter how good you think you are, we have all sinned, and no one thing with sin can enter the coming Kingdom of God and inherit the coming new earth, where this earth will end and God will remake his original plan, and end satan's rule as the god of this world.  Those that mock Christianity, are ignorant of the truth of Bible prophecy and stand on their own worldly moral concepts, but not those actual Biblical truths of God/Jesus, who did come to this earth as man, to die for all our sins, so that we could have eternal life.

author: Jay Tamayo

text: The Left Behind book was authored by Jerry B. Jenkins and Tim Lahaye. I have 3 books with the same title but in a Series with a different plot. Book 1 - The Vanishing, "Left Behind" > The Kids< Four kids faces Earth's Last days together. BUT I will not go through because we are to discuss the delusion itself. FROM the book "The Rapture Delusion" by Steve Wohlberg. On page 27 entitles 'Now You See Them, Now You Don't', he discussed the ERROR of this Rapture. He said "Although the exact word rapture isn't in the Bible, millions of prophecy-minded Christians (Meaning born again cult members) have nevertheless been caught that soon God's Church will disappear from Earth without a trace." JUST IMAGINE THIS we continue,  "Headlines are pre-directed to read "Multitude Missing, Chaos Sweep Globe!" "All Children Have Disappeared" "Massive Traffic Snarls Due to Evaporated Drivers" Planet Crash, Trains Wreck, as Pilots and Engineers Vanish!" perhaps you've seen bumper, "this vehicle will be unmanned".   On the same page and to the next, Steve mentioned the Author of the book Left behind and its series. Let us go to what the books says or the authors. pg. 29, "First, Jesus comes invisibly to remove His Church before a seven-year tribulation, during which the rest of humanity must face the antichrist. This is the rapture. at the end of those seven years, Jesus will again return visibly to deliver those who became Christians (it means Born Again cult members) during tribulation after being given a "second chance" to be saved - and to pulverize the invading enemies of Israel at Armaggedon. This is the second coming. Thus, it's rapture firstm then seven years with the antichrist, then the visible second coming of Jesus Christ." on page 30 Steve said "These popular concept - rapture, seven years f horror, future antichirst - have been taught in many apocalyptic Christian (it means Born Again cult members) films such as A Thief in the Night, Image of the Beast, Tribulation Force, The Omega Code, Left Behind: The Movie, and Meggiddo." Do you wish to learn more???

text: This was actually a surprisingly good movie. At the start of it, I thought it was just going to be another badly produced Christian movie, but towards the middle of the movie onward it was really good.  At the beginning, I was worried about the possibility that a badly acted scene would pop up but it never did. I do admit that they did a good job of putting their best actors as leads.  Production, especially in beginning could have been a bit better but I think that the rest of the movie made up for it.  As far as Christian movies go, I feel like Pureflix is the best production company capable of putting Hollywood quality movies forward but whatever company produced this one is not far behind.  7/10 stars

The second hand passes a certain point on the clock face and a child goes from completely innocent of all sin to TOTALLY accountable.     And here is the lamest thing about this widely held doctrine...it is taught no where in the Bible....

It is eating (partaking) of the "the fruit" (the resultant act) of choosing to KNOW (the knowledge/knowing) of what is "good and evil" (what is right and if not right) ...which just as the Bible says is mere FALLIBLE PEOPLE deciding willfully to be "AS God to KNOW what is good and evil" ....Swearing falsely in God's "name" ...saying via our chosen doctrine "THUS says GOD" even though in our heart of heart?  We of course KNOW it is simply a gamble we decided to bet our soul on....

text: John 3:16. God isn’t mad at the world.  He loves all and wishes above all things that not one will perish.  He sent his son to die for the world’s sins.  On the cross, Jesus paid for the sins of the world.  Every sin that any person has, is, or will ever commit, was put on his body.  There’s only one sin he will judge you on.  The sin of not believing on Jesus Christ as your Lord and Savior. This is all in his Word.  Don’t let baby Christians try to condemn you.  The Gospel is the Good news.  He’s not angry.  There isn’t anything you can do to deserve his grace and mercy.  It’s a perfect gift from a loving God and once you get to know him,  you’ll never be the same again.

text: RAPTURE READY!  We are "on call" 24/7 awaiting the CALL of Jesus Christ from space above. Maranatha! HE COMES.  John 14: 1 Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me. 2 In my Father's house are many mansions: if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you. 3 And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto myself; that where I am, there ye may be also.  Titus 2: 11 For the grace of God that brings salvation hath appeared to all men, 12 Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world; 13 Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Savior Jesus Christ; 14 Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works. 15 These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.  We KNOW this IS our time to serve God's glory.  The Great Commission Jesus says, "And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature." Mark chapter 15: verse 16  Romans 10 : verse 17: So faith comes by hearing and hearing by the word of God.  Romans 10: 13 For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved. 14 How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher? 15 And how shall they preach, except they be sent? as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!  Believe  Isaiah chapter 7: verse 14: Therefore, the Lord Himself will give you a sign; Behold, a virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and shall call him Emmanuel meaning: Hebrew: עִמָּנוּאֵל, "God with us" (Jesus Christ) in human flesh as man, but without sin. His shed blood would eventually pay the price for all the sins of all sinners! And he would be crucified and die and rise from the dead on the third day. Jesus had to die. His death, burial, resurrection, and shedding of His sinless blood were necessary to pay for all sins once and for all. (See * 1 Corinthians 15: 3-4 and * Ephesians 1: 7 below)  " For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;" Romans chapter 3: verse 23  "The wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord." Romans chapter 6: verse 23  John 3 16 For God so loved the world that he gave his only-begotten Son, so that everyone who believes in him should not perish but have everlasting life. 17 For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world; but may the world through him be saved.  "I am the way, the truth and the life: nobody comes to the Father but through me". (John 14.6)  "... Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures, and was buried, and on the third day he rose again according to the Scriptures" 1 Cor. 15: 3-4  "In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace." Ephesians 1: 7  "Because this is my blood from the New Testament, which is shed for many for the forgiveness of sins." Matthew, chap. 26: verse 28  Ephesians 2: "8 For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God: 9 Not of works, lest any man should boast.  Romans 10: 9 That if you shall confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus, and shall believe in your heart that God has raised him from the dead, you shall be saved. 10 For with the heart man believes unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation. 13 For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.  Salvation, the forgiveness of sins, is available to anyone who has received the Gospel who trusts Jesus Christ as their Lord and Savior. Those who have rejected salvation (see John 3: 16-17 above), according to the Gospel of Jesus Christ, will suffer judgment for their sins (perish) and eternal separation from God and the Family of God on earth and in heaven forever in the Lake of Fire. (Revelation chapters @; @,14-15; 21:8)  "Therefore, since we are justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ." Romans 5: 1
